Posted - 12/15/2011 : 08:20:48 AM I had a gas station shop. The beginning portion of the shop was a mystery and the second part was revealed. This location had a sandwich shop inside it. Being a route shopper, I tend to eat in places like this when I am on the road. I may rethink that in future!
I entered the store and chose my purchase. The cashier rang up the purchase and as I was paying I looked up - right into the eyes of a dog, standing on the counter where the sandwiches are prepared. I calmly left the store, parked my car, went back inside with my gear and revealed myself. The dog was still there. I whipped out my camera, snapped the picture, the cashier blinked, realized a camera was in my hand, and dove in front of the dog. Arms waiving, the cashier pleaded with me to delete the photo because the owner wouldn't like having the dog there and would fire everyone. I responded that I could not do that, and the cashier asked, "Why?" I told the cashier, "Because that would be unethical and dishonest." What I THOUGHT was...."Dude, you DO realize that ALL of this is on camera, including this conversation?"
